title.narrative: Sustainable Livelihoods Programme: Development of pro-poor footwear clusters and value chains in border regions of the Islamic Republics of Iran and Afghanistan (Phase I)

description.narrative: In 2013 UNIDO implemented the project Sustainable Livelihoods Programme: Development of pro-poor clusters and value chains in border regions of the Islamic Republics of Iran and Afghanistan Phase I. The Phase I of the project originated from the letter of request submitted to UNIDO by UNHCR Iran Office on 24 May 2012, expressing their interest in the development of a joint livelihood programme for the provinces Khorasan Razavi (Iran) and Herat (Afghanistan) as a part of the wider Solution Strategy for Afghan Refugees. Building on the achievements of the first phase, the current proposed initiative aims at supporting establishment of pilot pro-poor cluster initiatives in the two provinces, taking into account the necessity to upgrade operations of micro and small scale enterprises and production units operating in the selected localities, while at the same time strengthen the social tissue and improve livelihoods of the target population.
